main_result.name: Coordination-Energy Uncertainty Principle
main_result.significance: Directly connects hbar and c to coordination

numerical_examples.interpretation: Minimum energy uncertainty per coordination round uncertainty
numerical_examples.practical_note: At kT (room temp), this allows ~3e11 coordination rounds per joule

numerical_examples.interpretation: Global consensus has lower uncertainty bound
numerical_examples.practical_note: Light takes 0.13s to circle Earth - this is the fundamental limit
This is ~1e-24 J - approaching single photon energies

numerical_examples.interpretation: At Planck scale, bound equals Planck energy!

all_checks.test: Reduces to Heisenberg when tau_round is well-defined
all_checks.derivation: Delta_E * Delta_C * tau_round = Delta_E * Delta_T >= hbar/2
If E is fixed, max C/T = 2E/(pi*hbar), matches our bound
hbar*c/d has units J*s*(m/s)/m = J - correct for energy

all_checks.test: Gives Planck energy at Planck length

q23_progress.unified_equation: In progress - candidate: E * C * d/c >= hbar/2
